title: What advice could you give to a young INTP woman when she is struggling with an existential crisis? - Quora

response.answer_text: During this pandemic I have had my fair share of existential crisis. I often find myself thinking about the second law of thermodynamics and how in the universe at the time of the heat death every atom will eventually seperate from every other atom, and those atoms will eventually deteriorate into pure energy and what that entails for any kind of notion of meaning in the universe. Over the summer sometimes I would even question the validity of reality itself, I began thinking about dreams and how we never suspect we are in dreams when we are in a dream, and that the brain could be stimulated in the right way as to constitute all our sensations and thoughts, and that my thoughts may not even be my own, and then I comtemplated suicide on the basis of that absurd line of thought. The problem was I was stuck alone in my own head in a basement and an INTPs head fills with thoughts and ideas that would seem absurd to the rest of the world, in fact I was thinking about a machine that eradicated human emotion by inserting a large dose of seritonin that acts as an inhibator to stress and depression into the limbic area, essentially shutting it down completely because so much of the hormone seritonin is concentrated into that area. My point is you need other people to make you sane, any mind especially an INTP mind with its brilliance and creativity and madness in that combination needs other people to tell you your ideas are absolutely absurd, that you are on an unhealthy train of thought. Now I know that other people are not the forte of us INTPs, but get involved in a theatre or music group start a band, but if you dont have that time you could even join a Facebook page with people of similar veiws to yourself, it provides for creative input for the Ne to flourish on so it does not run out of ideas. But using Fe to much is draining trust me, and dont be a chamelon and try to be everything for everyone geniunely express your veiws, ideas, and personality. But have a healthy balance of alone time and time with others. Also enjoy the bueaty of nature it tends to soften my veiws on spirituality and the meaning of the universe. Hope this helps.

I am 33years old and suffering from an existential crisis as well. Ever since my mom died its like life became too real for me to handle and now I cant find reasons for doing anything 😪 😕 😔. I find meaning in my work and the love I have for my boyfriend but….I lost my first child to adoption, I lost 4 more kids to an ex in a custody battle, list my husband of 10 years to meth, lost my step-dad 6 years ago, my real dad last December, my mom….very suddenly and unexpectedly February 20, and I just cant for the life of me see a point 🙃 in life anymore. Why get attached when leaving is inevitable and often so painful? Who am I if not a mom a daughter a wife? Like I said, I find meaning in my work. Im a pizza delivery driver for Dominos. Best company in the world to work for and showing up with a hot pizza to someone's house is always welcomed and warmly greeted. I can get in a flow state.
